body.p:
To
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

We the undersigned citizens of Ca Lyon County Kentucky (formerly a part of Caldwell County) have long Known Thomas. B. Wadlington, and he has been considered for many years past, a good, and true hearted citizen, Known & noted for his industry & orderly conduct. The difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A. Cartwright did not appear to us, to be of his seeking nor are we satisfied, nor are we satisfied that the case was presented to the Jury as it really occurred. We hope your Excellency will review the case and give the poor man the benefit of every doubt, and we desire that his case may be Judged in mercy & regarded with favor. And that your Excelleny will take into consideration every circumstances, that ought to operate in his behalf, and we desire that your Excellency, may & will be persuaded, that it is consistent with your duty, to extend to him Executive Clemency, and that his life may be spared, either by a full pardon or a commutation of his punishment -- Yours respectfully
Jany 22d 1861 --
